data.name: InvalidLicenseKey
data.value:
The license key could not be validated.
Common causes of this problem are:
- Capitalization did not match exactly. - Extra spaces were entered after the name, or other changes were made to the license key text. - The organization was not entered correctly (note that you may need to enter "Personal"). - You are not using the latest version of Citavi (check on the Help menu or www.citavi.com).
Double-check that you entered everything correctly. If possible, cut and paste the info from the license email to avoid typos.
If your license key still does not work, contact us at www.citavi.com/service.

data.name: RepairCorruptedDatabase_DBCorrupt
data.value:
The project file is damaged.

Do you want Citavi to attempt to repair the project?

data.name: RepairCorruptedDatabase_NoWritePermissionInProjectFolder
data.value:

Do you want to try to save a repaired copy of the project to another location?

data.name: RepairCorruptedDatabase_RepairFailed
data.value:
An error occurred while repairing the project. Please check your computer for disk, USB flash drive, or memory problems.
You can try to open the project again later after restarting the computer. If it cannot be opened, restore from one of the backups Citavi created for you. If necessary, contact Citavi support for assistance: www.citavi.com/service.

data.name: RepairCorruptedDatabase_RepairInCustomFolderSuccessful_InconsistenciesFound
data.value:
Citavi was able to repair the project. Try to open the repaired project in Citavi. If you can, verify that you have write permissions to the original project folder, then replace the damaged project file with the repaired project file.
Citavi determined that some data loss occurred. A log with details has been saved and opened in a separate program.
To recover lost data, restore from one of the backups Citavi created for you. If necessary, contact Citavi support for assistance: www.citavi.com/service.

Please check your project for any data loss. While Citavi did not detect any errors, it is still possible.
To recover lost data, restore from one of the backups Citavi created for you. If necessary, contact Citavi support for assistance: www.citavi.com/service.

data.comment: JHP:das ist das Pendant zu RepairCorruptedDatabase_RepairFailed. Es gibt ja Korruptionsprobleme auf SQLite Ebene sowie Datenintegritätsprobleme für den Citavi Loader. Diese Fehlermeldung wird gezeigt, wenn LETZTERE nicht mehr automatisch repariert werden können. Es kann aber dem Support durchaus noch gelingen. Beispiel: Doppelte Zitate von Ms. Knoth

data.name: RepairIntegrity_UserMessage_FileReadOnlyForUnknownReason

Data inconsistencies in your project "{0}" are preventing Citavi from loading correctly. Citavi can try to repair these inconsistencies. However, write permission is currently not allowed for this project.
Please try to allow write permission. If necessary, please contact your system administrator or Citavi support for assistance: www.citavi.com/service.

data.name: RepairIntegrity_UserMessage
data.value:
Data inconsistencies in your project "{0}" are preventing Citavi from loading correctly. Citavi can try to repair these inconsistencies.

data.comment:
Review and perhaps add the following: Citavi can try to repair these inconsistencies but needs exclusive write permissions for the project file.
First, please have all team members close the project. Then, reopen the project in order to run the repair.

data.name: SQLiteErrorCodeUnspecific
data.value:
An error occurred while accessing the project file.
The internal error message is:
{0}.

data.name: SQLiteError_Busy_FriendlyText
data.value:
Citavi could not access the project file because it is locked.
Common causes include:
1) The project file is on a network share and the network connection was interrupted. Try to re-establish the network connection and try again.
2) Another user is saving to the project file. Please wait a moment and try again.

data.name: SQLiteError_CantOpen_FriendlyText
data.value:
An error occurred while accessing the project file.
Common causes include:
1) The connection to the storage device (network share, USB flash drive, etc.) was interrupted. Try to re-establish the connection and try again.
2) Another program may be blocking the project's journal file. Please wait a moment and try again.

data.name: SQLiteError_Corrupt_FriendlyText
data.value:
The project file is damaged. Please check your computer for disk, USB flash drive, or memory problems.
You can try to open the project again after restarting the computer. If it still fails, restore your project from the backup Citavi creates for you. If you need assistance, contact Citavi support: www.citavi.com/service.

data.name: SQLiteError_Error_FriendlyText
data.value:
An error occurred while reading or writing the project file ("SQL error or missing database").
It is possible that the connection to the storage device (network share, USB flash drive, etc.) was interrupted. Try to re-establish the connection and try again.
If this error persists, please contact Citavi support for assistance: www.citavi.com/service.

data.name: SQLiteError_Full_FriendlyText
data.value: The project file could not be accessed because the disk is full.

data.name: SQLiteError_IOErr_FriendlyText
data.value:
Citavi could not access the project file because the file could not be read or written to.
Common causes include:
1) The connection to the storage device (network share, USB flash drive, etc.) was interrupted. Try to re-establish the connection and try again.
2) The user account you are using has the Windows file permission "Write" but not "Modify". Contact your system administrator for assistance.
3) The Windows file permissions or write-protection were changed while the project was open in Citavi. Contact your system administrator for assistance.

data.name: SQLiteError_ReadOnly_FriendlyText
data.value:
Citavi could not access the project file because the file is read-only.
This problem can occur if a background program (such as an online backup program) set the project file to read-only after Citavi opened it.
You can try the following steps:
1) Wait a few minutes for the background program to finish and release the file. 2) Identify and close the background program. 3) Identify the background program and set it to ignore the Citavi project file.

data.name: CRM_Email_AccountCreatedViaProcessOrderMailBilling_Home_button
data.value: Choose a password

data.name: CRM_Email_AccountCreatedViaProcessOrderMailBilling_Home_first_paragraph
data.value: Here's how you can get everything set up: Step 1 – Create an account Create a password you can use to log in to your account. Click the blue button:

data.name: CRM_Email_AccountCreatedViaProcessOrderMailBilling_Home_last_paragraph
data.value: Step 2 – Install Citavi 6 Install Citavi 6 if you haven't already: www.citavi.com/download Step 3 – Log in to Citavi 6 After you start Citavi you will be asked to log in to Citavi Account. Enter your email address and password. If you have trouble, please use our login tips: www.citavi.com/login-hints Citavi 6 will automatically pull your license information from your account. If you run into any trouble, please get in touch: www.citavi.com/ticket

data.name: CRM_Email_AccountCreatedViaProcessOrderMailBilling_Home_subject
data.value: Welcome to Citavi 6!

data.name: CRM_Email_AccountCreatedViaProcessOrderMailBilling_Business_button
data.value: Choose a password

data.name: CRM_Email_AccountCreatedViaProcessOrderMailBilling_Business_first_paragraph
data.value: Here's how you can get everything set up: Step 1 – Create an account Create a password you can use to log in to your account. Click the blue button:

data.name: CRM_Email_AccountCreatedViaProcessOrderMailBilling_Business_last_paragraph
data.value: Step 2 – Assign licenses If you haven't done so already, log in to your Citavi account at www.citavi.com/login. Assign each license to a user at your organization. Users without a Citavi account will receive an email asking them to create one. Step 3 – Install Citavi 6 If you haven't done so already, install Citavi 6 on the users' computers. Download the Setup file and MSI Setup at www.citavi.com/download If you are upgrading from a previous version of Citavi, please read the following information: www.citavi.com/c6upgrade Step 4 – Log in to Citavi 6 After you start Citavi you will be asked to log in to Citavi Account. Users should enter their email addresses and passwords. If they have trouble, please have them use our login tips: www.citavi.com/login-hints Citavi 6 will automatically pull the license information from the account. If you run into any trouble, please get in touch: www.citavi.com/ticket

data.name: CRM_Email_AccountCreatedViaProcessOrderMailBilling_Business_subject
data.value: Welcome to Citavi 6!

data.name: CRM_Email_AccountCreatedViaProcessOrderMailBilling_DbServer_button
data.value: Choose a password

data.name: CRM_Email_AccountCreatedViaProcessOrderMailBilling_DbServer_first_paragraph
data.value: Here's how you can get everything set up: Step 1 – Install Citavi for DBServer See our checklist for setting up Citavi for DBServer: www.citavi.com/dbserver_checklist Step 2 – Create an account Create a password you can use to log in to your account. Click the blue button:

data.name: CRM_Email_AccountCreatedViaProcessOrderMailBilling_DbServer_last_paragraph
data.value: Step 3 – Download the license file If you haven't done so already, log in to your Citavi account at www.citavi.com/login. There you can download the Citavi for DBServer license file. Step 4 – Apply the license file Start Citavi DBServer Manager and use it to load the license file in your Citavi database. If you run into any trouble, please get in touch: www.citavi.com/ticket

data.name: CRM_Email_AccountCreatedViaProcessOrderMailBilling_DbServer_subject
data.value: Welcome to Citavi 6!

data.name: CRM_Email_OrderProcessBilling_Business_first_paragraph
data.value: Here's how you can get everything set up: Step 1 – Assign licenses If you haven't done so already, log in to your Citavi account at www.citavi.com/login. Assign each license to a user at your organization. Users without a Citavi account will receive an email asking them to create one. Step 2 – Install Citavi 6 If you haven't done so already, install Citavi 6 on the users' computers. Download the Setup file and MSI Setup at www.citavi.com/download Please read the following upgrade information: www.citavi.com/c6upgrade Step 3 – Have your users log in to Citavi 6 After they start Citavi, users will be asked to log in to Citavi Account. They should enter their email addresses and passwords. If they have trouble, please have them use our login tips: www.citavi.com/login-hints Citavi 6 will automatically pull the license information from the account. If you run into any trouble, please get in touch: www.citavi.com/ticket

data.name: CRM_Email_OrderProcessBilling_Business_subject
data.value: Welcome to Citavi 6!

data.name: CRM_Email_OrderProcessBilling_DbServer_first_paragraph
data.value: Here's how you can get everything set up: Step 1 – Install Citavi for DBServer See our checklist for setting up Citavi for DBServer: www.citavi.com/dbserver_checklist Step 2 – Download the license file Log in to your Citavi account at www.citavi.com/login. There you can download the Citavi for DBServer license file. Step 3 – Apply the license file Start Citavi DBServer Manager and use it to load the license file in your Citavi database. If you run into any trouble, please get in touch: www.citavi.com/ticket

data.name: CRM_Email_OrderProcessBilling_DbServer_subject
data.value: Welcome to Citavi 6!

data.name: CRM_Email_OrderProcessBilling_Home_first_paragraph
data.value: Here's how you can get everything set up: Step 1 – Install Citavi 6 Please take a look at our upgrade information: http://www.citavi.com/c6upgrade Install Citavi 6 if you haven't already. Download: www.citavi.com/download Step 2 – Log in to Citavi 6 After you start Citavi you will be asked to log in to Citavi Account. Enter your email address and password. If you have trouble, please use our login tips: www.citavi.com/login-hints Citavi 6 will automatically pull your license information from your account. If you run into any trouble, please get in touch: www.citavi.com/ticket

As a result, the following fields do not take different time zones into account: \i Created\i0 , \i Modified\i0 , \i Task assigned to\i0 , \i Task completed on\i0 . \par Your Citavi version can now correct the time zone. \line\line\b Important:\par
\pard{\pntext\f1\'B7\tab}{\*\pn\pnlvlblt\pnf1\pnindent0{\pntxtb\'B7}}\fi-360\li720\sa160\sl252\slmult1\b0 This change won't affect dates or time information in your bibliography.\par {\pntext\f1\'B7\tab}Anyone else who is working with this project must also be using Citavi 6.2 or later.\par {\pntext\f1\'B7\tab}If you make the correction now, all other team members must close the project.\par {\pntext\f1\'B7\tab}The project will automatically close and reopen after the conversion.\par }

data.name: CRM_Email_CampusContractExtensionInfoMail_first_paragraph
data.value: The site license that you purchased for your employees and students has been renewed. All Citavi users will receive an email informing them of the next steps to take.

data.name: CRM_Email_CampusContractExtensionInfoMail_second_paragraph
data.value: Citavi 6 users have to confirm that they are still members of your organization. Depending on your chosen settings, this can be accomplished by (a) clicking the confirmation link in the email; (b) logging in to Shibboleth; (c) entering a voucher code. No license information is copied and then entered in Citavi. ##newline Citavi 5 users have to log in to their Citavi accounts. There, the license key can be found and must be copied to the Clipboard. It can then be entered in Citavi 5. Users can also request license keys for earlier versions of Citavi. Please see ##helpgetoldversion for more information.

data.name: CRM_Email_OrderProcessBilling_Billomat_Business_first_paragraph
data.value: Here's how you can get everything set up: Step 1 – Assign licenses If you haven't done so already, log in to your Citavi account at www.citavi.com/login. Assign each license to a user at your organization. Users without a Citavi account will receive an email asking them to create one. Step 2 – Install Citavi 6 If you haven't done so already, install Citavi 6 on the users' computers. Download the Setup file and MSI Setup at www.citavi.com/download Please read the following upgrade information: www.citavi.com/c6upgrade Step 3 – Have your users log in to Citavi 6 After they start Citavi, users will be asked to log in to Citavi Account. They should enter their email addresses and passwords. If they have trouble, please have them use our login tips: www.citavi.com/login-hints Citavi 6 will automatically pull the license information from the account. If you run into any trouble, please get in touch: www.citavi.com/ticket ##invoicenumber ##customerordernumber

data.name: CRM_Email_OrderProcessBilling_Billomat_Business_subject
data.value: Welcome to Citavi 6!

data.name: CRM_Email_OrderProcessBilling_Billomat_DbServer_first_paragraph
data.value: Here's how you can get everything set up: Step 1 – Install Citavi for DBServer See our checklist for setting up Citavi for DBServer: www.citavi.com/dbserver_checklist Step 2 – Download the license file Log in to your Citavi account at www.citavi.com/login. There you can download the Citavi for DBServer license file. Step 3 – Apply the license file Start Citavi DBServer Manager and use it to load the license file in your Citavi database. If you run into any trouble, please get in touch: www.citavi.com/ticket ##invoicenumber ##customerordernumber

data.name: CRM_Email_OrderProcessBilling_Billomat_DbServer_subject
data.value: Welcome to Citavi 6!

data.name: CRM_Email_OrderProcessBilling_Billomat_Home_first_paragraph
data.value: Here's how you can get everything set up: Step 1 – Install Citavi 6 Please take a look at our upgrade information: http://www.citavi.com/c6upgrade Install Citavi 6 if you haven't already. Download: www.citavi.com/download Step 2 – Log in to Citavi 6 After you start Citavi you will be asked to log in to Citavi Account. Enter your email address and password. If you have trouble, please use our login tips: www.citavi.com/login-hints Citavi 6 will automatically pull your license information from your account. If you run into any trouble, please get in touch: www.citavi.com/ticket ##invoicenumber ##customerordernumber

data.name: CRM_Email_OrderProcessBilling_Billomat_Home_subject
data.value: Welcome to Citavi 6!
